forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 35. West wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 53. West wind 6 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
As Boston awakens from the night’s embrace, a curtain of clouds lingers, casting a muted tone over the early hours. With temperatures resting atop a chilly 35 degrees, the air carries a crispness, hinting at the lingering vestiges of winter. The gentle sway of the west wind, whispering through the nooks and corners of the city, speaks of the day to come—a promise of the sun’s warmth filtered through patches of scattered clouds.

As Tuesday unfolds, the sky is set to reveal its more amiable side. The day will gradually brighten, adorned with bursts of sunlight that coax the temperature to a comfortable 53 degrees. With the breeze at a mild 6 to 12 mph, it’s a day when light layers are your best ally; a cozy sweater coupled with a light jacket will allow one to navigate the shifting temperatures of this early spring day comfortably. 

One might find pleasure in a leisurely stroll along the Charles, beneath the burgeoning buds of trees coming alive with the season. Alternatively, a visit to a local café, where the aroma of fresh brews and baked goods wafts through the air, could serve as the perfect haven from the coolness of the morning. Whether wandering through the streets adorned with history or savoring a moment of repose with a beloved book, today unfolds as an invitation to embrace simplicity and connect with the city’s heart as it transitions into spring.
